Key Arguments: The bill is seen as a form of censorship that infringes on free speech.
Empowering ACMA with new powers will lead to increased censorship and control over digital platforms.
The bill lacks transparency and does not adequately protect free speech.
There is concern that the bill could lead to a government-sponsored mandatory internet filter.
The bill is viewed as part of a broader trend of government overreach and erosion of democratic freedoms.
Main Themes: Concerns about Legal and Systemic Censorship
Notable Quotes: We declare any measure or system which impedes free speech, intentionally or unintentionally, to be censorship.
The bill, by its very design, is framed around a core purpose of restricting free speech and opinion to a tightly controlled and regulated scope, to be defined by the ACMA.
We believe ‘legal censorship’ is chilling and always unacceptable, and is something we will always vehemently oppose.
We are truly, extremely, concerned that this bill is moving Australia another step closer to implementing a government-sponsored mandatory internet filter.
